meanings.definition: A type of protein found in starch.
meanings.sent1: Amylopsins are important proteins in starch.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study amylopsins to understand their role in starch.
meanings.sent3: The chef added extra amylopsins to the recipe, hoping to enhance the starchiness.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of amylopsins was as clear as a freshly starched shirt.
meanings.sent5: The classroom model vividly demonstrated the function of amylopsins in starch digestion.

meanings.sent1: Digestive enzymes like amylopsins help break down starch in food.
meanings.sent2: Amylopsins play a crucial role in the digestion of starch in the body.
meanings.sent3: The amylopsins in the stomach were on a mission to break down all the starches.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to understand amylopsins was as strong as the enzymes breaking down starch.
meanings.sent5: The image of amylopsins working tirelessly to break down starch stuck in her mind.

meanings.definition: Proteins that aid in the digestion of carbohydrates.
meanings.sent1: Amylopsins are essential for the digestion of carbohydrates in the body.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how amylopsins help in breaking down carbohydrates efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The amylopsins in the digestive system threw a party every time they successfully digested carbohydrates.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of amylopsins' role in carbohydrate digestion was as clear as a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The textbook illustration made the process of amylopsins aiding in carbohydrate digestion easy to remember.
